‘What about you?’
‘I’m going to be a knight /рыцарь/,’ said Ron.

The chessmen /шахматисты/ seemed to have been listening, because at these words a knight /рыцарь/, a bishop /епископ/ and a castle turned their backs /спины/ on the white pieces /куски/ and walked off the board /доска/ leaving three empty squares /квадраты/ which Harry, Ron and Hermione took.
‘White always plays /игры/ first in chess,’ said Ron, peering /всматриваясь/ across the board /доска/. ‘Yes ... look ...’
A white pawn /пешка/ had moved forward two squares /квадраты/.
Ron started to direct /непосредственный/ the black pieces /куски/. They moved silently /молча/ wher /порога/­ever he sent them. Harry’s knees were trembling /дрожь/. What if they lost?
‘Harry – move diagonally /по диагонали/ four squares /квадраты/ to the right.’

Their first real shock came when their other knight /рыцарь/ was taken. The white queen /Королева/ smashed /разбили/ him to the floor and dragged /тащили/ him off the board /доска/, where he lay quite still, face down.
‘Had to let that happen /случаться/,’ said Ron, looking shaken /встряхивают/. ‘Leaves you free to take that bishop /епископ/, Hermione, go on.’

Every time one of their men /люди/ was lost, the white pieces /куски/ showed no mercy /милость/. Soon there was a huddle /жаться/ of limp /прихрамывать/ black players /игроки/ slumped /упал/ along the wall. Twice, Ron only just noticed in time that Harry and Hermione were in danger /Опасность/. He himself darted /заметался/ around the board /доска/ taking almost as many white pieces /куски/ as they had lost black ones.
‘We’re nearly there,’ he muttered suddenly. ‘Let me think – let me think ...’
The white queen /Королева/ turned her blank /пустой/ face towards him.
‘Yes ...’ said Ron softly /мягко/, ‘it’s the only way ... I’ve got to be taken.’
‘NO!’ Harry and Hermione shouted.
‘That’s chess!’ snapped Ron. ‘You’ve got to make some sacrifices /жертвы/! I’ll make my move and she’ll /оболочка/ take me – that leaves you free to checkmate /мат/ the king /король/, Harry!’
‘But –’
‘Do you want to stop Snape or not?’
‘Ron –’
‘Look, if you don’t hurry up, he’ll already have the Stone!’
There was nothing else for it.
‘Ready?’ Ron called, his face pale but determined /определенный/. ‘Here I go – now, don’t hang /вешать/ around once you’ve won.’

He stepped forward and the white queen /Королева/ pounced /накинулся/. She struck /пораженный/ Ron hard around the head with her stone arm and he crashed /разбившийся/ to the floor – Hermione screamed but stayed /остались/ on her square /квадрат/ – the white queen /Королева/ dragged /тащили/ Ron to one side. He looked as if he’d been knocked out.
Shaking, Harry moved three spaces /пространства/ to the left.

The white king /король/ took off his crown /корона/ and threw it at Harry’s feet. They had won. The chessmen /шахматисты/ parted /расставался/ and bowed /поклонилась/, leaving the door ahead clear /Чисто/. With one last desperate /отчаянный/ look back at Ron, Harry and Hermione charged /заряженный/ through the door and up the next passageway /перепускной канал/.
‘What if he’s –?’
‘He’ll be all right,’ said Harry, trying to convince /убеждать/ himself. ‘What do you reckon /рассчитывать/’s next?’

‘We’ve had Sprout /росток/’s, that was the Devil’s /дьявольский/ Snare /западня/ – Flitwick must’ve /Должно быть/ put charms /Чары/ on the keys – McGonagall transfigured /преобразился/ the chessmen /шахматисты/ to make them alive /в живых/ – that leaves Quirrell’s spell, and Snape’s ...’
They had reached another door.
‘All right?’ Harry whispered.
‘Go on.’
Harry pushed it open.

A disgusting /отвратительный/ smell filled /заполненный/ their nostrils /ноздри/, making both of them pull their robes up over their noses /носы/. Eyes watering /полив/, they saw, flat /квартира/ on the floor in front of them, a troll even larger /больше/ than the one they had tackled /решать/, out cold with a bloody /кровавый/ lump /кусковой/ on its head.
‘I’m glad we didn /А не было/’t have to fight /борьба/ that one,’ Harry whispered, as they stepped carefully over one of its massive /массивный/ legs. ‘Come on, I can’t breathe /дышать/.’

He pulled open the next door, both of them hardly daring /отважный/ to look at what came next – but there was nothing very frightening /пугающий/ in here, just a table with seven differently /иначе/ shaped /фасонный/ bottles /бутылки/ standing on it in a line.
‘Snape’s,’ said Harry. ‘What do we have to do?’

They stepped over the threshold /порог/ and immediately /немедленно/ a fire sprang /Sprang/ up behind them in the doorway /дверной проем/. It wasn /WASN/’t ordinary /обычный/ fire either; it was purple. At the same instant /мгновенное/, black flames /огонь/ shot up in the doorway /дверной проем/ leading /ведущий/ onwards /далее/. They were trapped /ловушке/.
‘Look!’ Hermione seized a roll /рулон/ of paper lying next to the bottles /бутылки/. Harry looked over her shoulder to read it:

p.emphasis: Danger /Опасность/ lies /вранье/ before you, while safety /безопасность/ lies /вранье/ behind,
Two of us will help you, whichever /какой бы ни/ you would find,
One among /среди/ us seven will let you move ahead,
Another will transport /транспорт/ the drinker /пьющий/ back instead,
Two among /среди/ our number hold only nettle /крапива/ wine /вино/,
Three of us are killers /убийцы/, waiting hidden /скрытый/ in line.
Choose /выберите/, unless /если/ you wish /желание/ to stay here for evermore /навсегда/,
To help you in your choice /выбор/, we give you these clues /ключи/ four:
First, however slyly /хитро/ the poison /яд/ tries /пытается/ to hide /скрывать/
You will always find some on nettle /крапива/ wine /вино/’s left side;
Second, different are those who stand at either end,
But if you would move onwards /далее/, neither /ни/ is your friend;
Third, as you see clearly, all are different size /размер/,
Neither /ни/ dwarf /карликовый/ nor /ни/ giant holds /держит/ death /смерть/ in their insides /внутренности/;
Fourth /четвертый/, the second left and the second on the right
Are twins once you taste /вкус/ them, though different at first sight.

section.p: Hermione let out a great sigh /вздох/ and Harry, amazed /пораженный/, saw that she was smiling, the very last thing he felt like doing.

‘Brilliant /блестящий/,’ said Hermione. ‘This isn’t magic – it’s logic /логика/ – a puzzle /головоломка/. A lot of the greatest /величайший/ wizards haven’t got an ounce /унция/ of logic /логика/, they’d be stuck /застрял/ in here for ever.’
‘But so will we, won’t we?’

‘Of course not,’ said Hermione. ‘Everything we need is here on this paper. Seven bottles /бутылки/: three are poison /яд/; two are wine /вино/; one will get us safely /безопасно/ through the black fire and one will get us back through the purple.’
‘But how do we know which to drink /напиток/?’
‘Give me a minute.’
Hermione read the paper several times. Then she walked up and down the line of bottles /бутылки/, muttering /бормотание/ to herself /сама/ and pointing at them. At last, she clapped her hands.
‘Got it,’ she said. ‘The smallest /наименьшее/ bottle will get us through the black fire – towards the Stone.’
Harry looked at the tiny bottle.
‘There’s only enough there for one of us,’ he said. ‘That’s hardly one swallow /глотать/.’
They looked at each other.
‘Which one will get you back through the purple flames /огонь/?’
Hermione pointed at a rounded /закругленный/ bottle at the right end of the line.

‘You drink /напиток/ that,’ said Harry. ‘No, listen – get back and get Ron – grab /грейфер/ brooms from the flying-key /летающий ключ/ room, they’ll /они будут/ get you out of the trapdoor and past Fluffy – go straight to the owlery /совятню/ and send Hedwig to Dumbledore, we need him. I might be able to hold Snape off for a while, but I’m no match for him really.’
‘But Harry – what if You-Know /вы знаете/-Who’s /Вы знаете кто это/ /кто/ with him?’
‘Well – I was lucky once, wasn /WASN/’t I?’ said Harry, pointing at his scar. ‘I might get lucky again.’
Hermione’s lip /губа/ trembled /задрожала/ and she suddenly dashed /пунктирная/ at Harry and threw her arms around him.
‘Harry – you’re a great wizard, you know.’
‘I’m not as good as you,’ said Harry, very embarrassed /смущенный/, as she let go of him.
‘Me!’ said Hermione. ‘Books! And cleverness /одаренность/! There are more important things – friendship /дружба/ and bravery /храбрость/ and – oh Harry – be careful /осторожный/!’
‘You drink /напиток/ first,’ said Harry. ‘You are sure which is which, aren /Арен/’t you?’
‘Positive /положительный/,’ said Hermione. She took a long drink /напиток/ from the round bottle at the end and shuddered /содрогнулся/.
‘It’s not poison /яд/?’ said Harry anxiously /с тревогой/.
‘No – but it’s like ice /лед/.’
‘Quick /быстро/, go, before it wears /носит/ off.’
‘Good luck /везение/ – take care /забота/ –’
‘GO!’
Hermione turned and walked straight through the purple fire.
Harry took a deep breath and picked up the smallest /наименьшее/ bottle. He turned to face the black flames /огонь/.
‘Here I come,’ he said and he drained /осушенных/ the little bottle in one gulp /глоток/.

It was indeed /в самом деле/ as though ice /лед/ was flooding /затопление/ his body. He put the bottle down and walked forward; he braced /приготовился/ himself, saw the black flames /огонь/ licking /облизывание/ his body but couldn /не мог/’t feel them – for a moment he could see nothing but dark fire – then he was on the other side, in the last chamber.
There was already someone there – but it wasn /WASN/’t Snape. It wasn /WASN/’t even Voldemort.
It was Quirrell.
‘You!’ gasped Harry.
Quirrell smiled. His face wasn /WASN/’t twitching /дергающийся/ at all.
‘Me,’ he said calmly /спокойно/, ‘I wondered whether /будь то/ I’d be meeting /встреча/ you here, Potter.’
‘But I thought – Snape –’

‘Severus /Severus/?’ Quirrell laughed /рассмеялся/ and it wasn /WASN/’t his usual quivering /дрожащий/ treble /утроить/, either, but cold and sharp. ‘Yes, Severus /Severus/ does seem the type /тип/, doesn’t /не/ he? So useful /полезным/ to have him swooping /парящий/ around like an overgrown /заросший/ bat /летучая мышь/. Next to him, who would suspect /подозреваемый/ p-p-poor /р-р-бедных/ /бедные/ st /улица/-stuttering /заикание/ P-Professor /п-профессор/ Quirrell?’
Harry couldn /не мог/’t take it in. This couldn /не мог/’t be true, it couldn /не мог/’t.
‘But Snape tried to kill me!’

‘No, no, no. I tried to kill you. Your friend Miss Granger acci /AccI/­dentally /стоматологически/ knocked me over as she rushed /помчался/ to set fire to Snape at that Quidditch match. She broke my eye contact /контакт/ with you. Another few seconds and I’d have got you off that broom. I’d have man­aged /престарелый/ it before then if Snape hadn’t been muttering /бормотание/ a counter /счетчик/-curse /проклятие/, trying to save /спасти/ you.’
‘Snape was trying to save /спасти/ me?’

‘Of course,’ said Quirrell coolly /спокойно/. ‘Why do you think he wanted to referee /судья/ your next match? He was trying to make sure I didn /А не было/’t do it again. Funny, really ... he needn’t /не нужно/ have bothered /беспокоили/. I couldn /не мог/’t do anything with Dumbledore watching. All the other teachers thought Snape was trying to stop Gryffindor winning /выигрыш/, he did make himself unpopular /непопулярный/ ... and what a waste /отходы/ of time, when after all that, I’m going to kill you tonight.’
Quirrell snapped his fingers. Ropes /канаты/ sprang /Sprang/ out of thin air and wrapped /завернутый/ themselves tightly /плотно/ around Harry.
‘You’re too nosy /пронырливый/ to live, Potter. Scurrying /суетливый/ around the school at Hallowe’en like that, for all I knew you’d seen me coming to look at what was guarding the Stone.’
‘You let the troll in?’

‘Certainly /безусловно/. I have a special /особый/ gift /подарок/ with trolls /тролли/ – you must have seen what I did to the one in the chamber back there? Unfortunately /К сожалению/, while everyone else was running around looking for it, Snape, who already suspected /подозреваемый/ me, went straight to the third floor to head me off – and not only did my troll fail /потерпеть неудачу/ to beat /бить/ you to death /смерть/, that three-headed /двуглавый/ /трехголовый/ dog didn /А не было/’t even manage /управлять/ to bite /укусить/ Snape’s leg off properly /должным образом/.
‘Now, wait quietly, Potter. I need to examine /исследовать/ this interesting /интересно/ mirror.’
It was only then that Harry realised what was standing behind Quirrell. It was the Mirror of Erised /Еиналеж/.

‘This mirror is the key to finding /обнаружение/ the Stone,’ Quirrell mur /мур/­mured /mured/, tapping /нажав/ his way around the frame /Рамка/. ‘Trust /доверять/ Dumbledore to come up with something like this ... but he’s in London ... I’ll be far away by the time he gets /получает/ back ...’
All Harry could think of doing was to keep Quirrell talking and stop him concentrating /обогатительный/ on the Mirror.
‘I saw you and Snape in the Forest –’ he blurted /выпалила/ out.

‘Yes,’ said Quirrell idly /праздно/, walking around the Mirror to look at the back. ‘He was on to me by that time, trying to find out how far I’d got. He suspected /подозреваемый/ me all along. Tried to frighten /стращать/ me – as though he could, when I had Lord /господин/ Voldemort on my side ...’
Quirrell came back out from behind the Mirror and stared hun /гунн/­grily /grily/ into it.
‘I see the Stone ... I’m presenting /представление/ it to my master /мастер/ ... but where is it?’

Harry struggled /изо всех сил/ against the ropes /канаты/ binding /переплет/ him, but they didn /А не было/’t give. He had to keep Quirrell from giving /дающий/ his whole attention /внимание/ to the Mirror.
‘But Snape always seemed to hate /ненавидеть/ me so much.’

‘Oh, he does,’ said Quirrell casually /вскользь/, ‘heavens /небо/, yes. He was at Hogwarts with your father, didn /А не было/’t you know? They loathed /ненавидели/ each other. But he never wanted you dead.’
‘But I heard you a few days ago, sobbing /рыдание/ – I thought Snape was threatening /угрожающий/ you ...’
For the first time, a spasm /спазм/ of fear /страх/ flitted /порхали/ across Quirrell’s face.
‘Sometimes /иногда/,’ he said, ‘I find it hard to follow my master /мастер/’s instructions /инструкции/ – he is a great wizard and I am weak /слабый/ –’
‘You mean he was there in the classroom with you?’ Harry gasped.

‘He is with me wherever /где бы/ I go,’ said Quirrell quietly. ‘I met him when I travelled /путешествовал/ around the world. A foolish /глупый/ young /молодой/ man I was then, full of ridiculous /смешной/ ideas /идеи/ about good and evil /зло/. Lord /господин/ Voldemort showed me how wrong I was. There is no good and evil /зло/, there is only power, and those too weak /слабый/ to seek /искать/ it ... Since then, I have served /служил/ him faithfully /верно/, although I have let him down many times. He has had to be very hard on me.’ Quirrell shivered /задрожала/ suddenly. ‘He does not forgive /прощать/ mistakes /ошибки/ easily /без труда/. When I failed /не смогли/ to steal the Stone from Gringotts, he was most displeased /недовольный/. He punished /наказали/ me ... decided he would have to keep a closer watch on me ...’

Quirrell’s voice tailed /хвостатый/ away. Harry was remembering /вспоминание/ his trip /поездка/ to Diagon /Косой/ Alley /аллея/ – how could he have been so stupid? He’d seen Quirrell there that very day, shaken /встряхивают/ hands with him in the Leaky /неплотный/ Cauldron.
Quirrell cursed /проклят/ under his breath.
‘I don’t understand ... is the Stone inside the Mirror? Should I break it?’
Harry’s mind was racing.

What I want more than anything else in the world at the moment, he thought, is to find the Stone before Quirrell does. So if I look in the Mirror, I should see myself /себя/ finding /обнаружение/ it – which means /означает/ I’ll see where it’s hidden /скрытый/! But how can I look without Quirrell realising /понимая/ what I’m up to?

He tried to edge to the left, to get in front of the glass without Quirrell noticing /замечающий/, but the ropes /канаты/ around his ankles /щиколотки/ were too tight /в обтяжку/: he tripped /сработал/ and fell over. Quirrell ignored /игнорируются/ him. He was still talking to himself.
‘What does this mirror do? How does it work? Help me, Master /мастер/!’
And to Harry’s horror /ужастик/, a voice answered /ответил/, and the voice seemed to come from Quirrell himself.
‘Use the boy ... Use the boy ...’
Quirrell rounded /закругленный/ on Harry.
‘Yes – Potter – come here.’
He clapped his hands once and the ropes /канаты/ binding /переплет/ Harry fell off. Harry got slowly to his feet.
‘Come here,’ Quirrell repeated /повторный/. ‘Look in the Mirror and tell me what you see.’
Harry walked towards him.
‘I must lie /ложь/,’ he thought desperately /в отчаянии/. ‘I must look and lie /ложь/ about what I see, that’s all.’

Quirrell moved close behind him. Harry breathed /вдохнул/ in the funny smell that seemed to come from Quirrell’s turban. He closed /закрыто/ his eyes, stepped in front of the Mirror and opened them again.

He saw his reflection /отражение/, pale and scared-looking /страшно выглядящий/ at first. But a moment later, the reflection /отражение/ smiled at him. It put its hand into its pocket and pulled out a blood-red /кроваво красный/ stone. It winked /подмигнула/ and put the Stone back in its pocket – and as it did so, Harry felt something heavy drop /падение/ into his real pocket. Somehow – incredibly /невероятно/ – he’d got the Stone.
‘Well?’ said Quirrell impatiently /с нетерпением/. ‘What do you see?’
Harry screwed /пьяный/ up his courage /мужество/.
‘I see myself /себя/ shaking hands with Dumbledore,’ he invented /изобрел/. ‘I – I’ve won the House Cup for Gryffindor.’
Quirrell cursed /проклят/ again.
‘Get out of the way,’ he said. As Harry moved aside /в стороне/ he felt the Philosopher’s Stone against his leg. Dare he make a break for it?
But he hadn’t walked five paces /шагов/ before a high voice spoke, though Quirrell wasn /WASN/’t moving /перемещение/ his lips /губы/.
‘He lies /вранье/ ... He lies /вранье/ ...’
‘Potter, come back here!’ Quirrell shouted. ‘Tell me the truth /правда/! What did you just see?’
The high voice spoke again.
‘Let me speak to him ... face to face ...’
‘Master /мастер/, you are not strong enough!’
‘I have strength /прочность/ enough ... for this ...’

Harry felt as if Devil’s /дьявольский/ Snare /западня/ was rooting /укоренение/ him to the spot /место/. He couldn /не мог/’t move a muscle /мускул/. Petrified /окаменела/, he watched as Quirrell reached up and began to unwrap /разворачивать/ his turban. What was going on? The tur /тур/­ban /запрет/ fell away. Quirrell’s head looked strangely /странно/ small without it. Then he turned slowly on the spot /место/.

Harry would have screamed, but he couldn /не мог/’t make a sound. Where there should have been a back to Quirrell’s head, there was a face, the most terrible face Harry had ever seen. It was chalk /мел/ white with glaring /вопиющий/ red eyes and slits /щели/ for nostrils /ноздри/, like a snake.
‘Harry Potter ...’ it whispered.
Harry tried to take a step /шаг/ backwards /назад/ but his legs wouldn /Wouldn/’t move.

‘See what I have become /стали/?’ the face said. ‘Mere /всего лишь/ shadow /тень/ and vapour /пар/ ... I have form /форма/ only when I can share /доля/ another’s /чужой/ body ... but there have always been those willing /готовы/ to let me into their hearts /сердца/ and minds /умов/ ... Unicorn blood has strengthened /усиленный/ me, these past weeks /недель/ ... you saw faithful /верный/ Quirrell drinking /питьевой/ it for me in the Forest ... and once I have the Elixir /эликсир/ of Life, I will be able to create /Создайте/ a body of my own ... Now ... why don’t you give me that Stone in your pocket?’
So he knew The feeling suddenly surged /выросли/ back into Harry’s legs. He stumbled /споткнулся/ backwards /назад/.

‘Don’t be a fool /дурачить/,’ snarled /прорычал/ the face. ‘Better save /спасти/ your own life and join /присоединиться/ me ... or you’ll meet the same end as your parents ... They died begging /нищенство/ me for mercy /милость/ ...’
‘LIAR /лжец/!’ Harry shouted suddenly.
Quirrell was walking backwards /назад/ at him, so that Voldemort could still see him. The evil /зло/ face was now smiling.

‘How touching /трогательный/ ...’ it hissed /прошипел/. ‘I always value /стоимость/ bravery /храбрость/ ... Yes, boy, your parents were brave /Храбрый/ ... I killed your father first and he put up a courageous /отважный/ fight /борьба/ ... but your mother needn’t /не нужно/ have died ... she was trying to protect /защищать/ you ... Now give me the Stone, unless /если/ you want her to have died in vain /тщеславный/.’
‘NEVER!’

Harry sprang /Sprang/ towards the flame /пламя/ door, but Voldemort screamed, ‘SEIZE /воспользоваться/ HIM!’ and, next second, Harry felt Quirrell’s hand close on his wrist /запястье/. At once, a needle /игла/-sharp pain seared /притупленный/ across Harry’s scar; his head felt as though it was about to split /Трещина/ in two; he yelled, struggling /борющийся/ with all his might, and to his surprise /сюрприз/, Quirrell let go of him. The pain in his head lessened /уменьшило/ – he looked around wildly /дико/ to see where Quirrell had gone and saw him hunched /сгорбленный/ in pain, look­ing at his fingers – they were blistering /образование пузырей/ before his eyes.

‘Seize /воспользоваться/ him! SEIZE /воспользоваться/ HIM!’ shrieked /взвизгнул/ Voldemort again and Quirrell lunged /рванулся/, knocking /стук/ Harry clean /чистый/ off his feet, landing /посадка/ on top of him, both hands around Harry’s neck – Harry’s scar was almost blind /слепой/­ing him with pain, yet he could see Quirrell howling /воющий/ in agony /агония/.
‘Master /мастер/, I cannot /не могу/ hold him – my hands – my hands!’

And Quirrell, though pinning /прикрепляя/ Harry to the ground with his knees, let go of his neck and stared, bewildered /озадаченный/, at his own palms /ладони/ – Harry could see they looked burnt /сожжен/, raw /сырье/, red and shiny /блестящий/.
‘Then kill him, fool /дурачить/, and be done!’ screeched /завизжал/ Voldemort.
Quirrell raised his hand to perform /выполнять/ a deadly /смертоносный/ curse /проклятие/, but Harry, by instinct /инстинкт/, reached up and grabbed Quirrell’s face –
‘AAAARGH /Aaaargh/!’

Quirrell rolled off him, his face blistering /образование пузырей/ too, and then Harry knew: Quirrell couldn /не мог/’t touch his bare /голый/ skin /кожа/, not without suffering /страдающий/ terrible pain – his only chance was to keep hold of Quirrell, keep him in enough pain to stop him doing a curse /проклятие/.

Harry jumped to his feet, caught Quirrell by the arm and hung on as tight /в обтяжку/ as he could. Quirrell screamed and tried to throw /бросать/ Harry off – the pain in Harry’s head was building /здание/ – he couldn /не мог/’t see – he could only hear Quirrell’s terrible shrieks /вопли/ and Voldemort’s /Волдеморт/ yells /вопит/ of ‘KILL HIM! KILL HIM!’ and other voices /голоса/, maybe in Harry’s own head, crying /плач/, ‘Harry! Harry!’
He felt Quirrell’s arm wrenched /вывернул/ from his grasp /схватывание/, knew all was lost, and fell into blackness /чернота/, down ... down ... down ...
Something gold was glinting /сверкают/ just above him. The Snitch! He tried to catch it, but his arms were too heavy.
He blinked /моргнула/. It wasn /WASN/’t the Snitch at all. It was a pair of glasses. How strange.

And suddenly, their wardrobes /шкафы/ were empty, their trunks /стволы/ were packed /уплотненный/, Neville’s toad was found lurking /скрываясь/ in a corner of the toilets /туалеты/; notes /заметки/ were handed /руками/ out to all students, warning /предупреждение/ them not to use magic over the holidays /каникулы/ (‘I always hope they’ll /они будут/ forget to give us these,’ said Fred Weasley sadly /грустно/); Hagrid was there to take them down to the fleet /флот/ of boats /лодки/ that sailed /плавал/ across the lake /озеро/; they were boarding /посадка/ the Hogwarts Express /экспресс/; talking and laughing /смеющийся/ as the country /страна/­side became greener /зеленее/ and tidier /опрятнее/; eating /принимать пищу/ Bertie /Берти/ Bott’s /Ботта/ Every-Flavour /аромат/ /каждый аромат/ Beans /фасоль/ as they sped /ускоренный/ past Muggle towns /города/; pulling /тянущий/ off their wizard robes and putting /сдачи/ on jackets /жакеты/ and coats /пальто/; pulling /тянущий/ into platform nine and three-quarters /три четверти/ at King /король/’s /королевский/ Cross /пересекать/ Station /станция/.

It took quite a while for them all to get off the platform. A wizened /сморщенный/ old guard /охрана/ was up by the ticket barrier /барьер/, letting /сдача в аренду/ them go through the gate /Ворота/ in twos /двоек/ and threes /троек/ so they didn /А не было/’t attract /привлекать/ attention /внимание/ by all bursting /разрывной/ out of a solid /твердый/ wall at once and alarming /тревожный/ the Muggles.
‘You must come and stay this summer /лето/,’ said Ron, ‘both of you – I’ll send you an owl.’
‘Thanks,’ said Harry. ‘I’ll need something to look forward to.’
People jostled /затолкали/ them as they moved forwards /вперед/ towards the gate /Ворота/­way back to the Muggle world. Some of them called:
‘Bye /пока/, Harry!’
‘See you, Potter!’
‘Still famous,’ said Ron, grinning /ухмыляющийся/ at him.
‘Not where I’m going, I promise /обещание/ you,’ said Harry.
He, Ron and Hermione passed through the gateway /шлюз/ together.
‘There he is, Mum, there he is, look!’
It was Ginny /Ginny/ Weasley, Ron’s younger /моложе/ sister, but she wasn /WASN/’t pointing at Ron.
‘Harry Potter!’ she squealed /визжали/. ‘Look, Mum! I can see –’
‘Be quiet, Ginny /Ginny/, and it’s rude /грубый/ to point.’
Mrs Weasley smiled down at them.
‘Busy year?’ she said.
‘Very,’ said Harry. ‘Thanks for the fudge /помадка/ and the jumper /джемпер/, Mrs Weasley.’
‘Oh, it was nothing, dear.’
‘Ready, are you?’

It was Uncle Vernon, still purple-faced /фиолетовое лицо/, still moustached /усатый/, still looking furious /яростный/ at the nerve /нерв/ of Harry, carrying /проведение/ an owl in a cage /клетка/ in a station /станция/ full of ordinary /обычный/ people. Behind him stood Aunt Petunia and Dudley, looking terrified /ужас/ at the very sight of Harry.
‘You must be Harry’s family!’ said Mrs Weasley.
‘In a manner /манера/ of speaking /Говорящий/,’ said Uncle Vernon. ‘Hurry up, boy, we haven’t got all day.’ He walked away.
Harry hung back for a last word with Ron and Hermione.
‘See you over the summer /лето/, then.’
‘Hope you have – er – a good holiday /день отдыха/,’ said Hermione, looking uncertainly /нерешительно/ after Uncle Vernon, shocked /в шоке/ that anyone could be so unpleasant /неприятный/.

‘Oh, I will,’ said Harry, and they were surprised /удивленный/ at the grin /усмешка/ that was spreading /распространение/ over his face. ‘They don’t know we’re not allowed to use magic at home. I’m going to have a lot of fun /весело/ with Dudley this summer /лето/ ...’

p.emphasis: Scanned /сканируется/ in the dark by BeB /Beb/ for everyone who has purchased /купленный/ the book and laments /сокрушается/ the lack /отсутствие/ of any eBook /электронная книга/ releases /релизы/ by the Author /автор/.
